title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic novel of the Roaring Twenties.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about racial injustice in the Deep South.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about teenage rebellion and isolation.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A quest for revenge against a giant white whale.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel of manners in early 19th century England.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel about a society driven by technology and consumption.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The first volume of the epic fantasy trilogy.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young wizard embarks on his first year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A prequel to 'The Lord of the Rings' that tells the tale of Bilbo Baggins.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel about a man whose portrait ages while he stays young.

title: The Great Alone
author: Kristin Hannah
description: A family in Alaska faces its darkest secrets in the wilderness.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A historical narrative of the human species from the Stone Age to the modern age.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir of a woman who grows up in a strict, survivalist family and eventually escapes for an education.

title: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
description: A landmark work in science that addresses cosmology and black holes.

title: The Origin of Species
author: Charles Darwin
description: The foundational work on evolutionary biology and natural selection.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about a young Andalusian shepherd's journey to find his personal legend.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A science fiction epic about politics, religion, and ecology on the desert planet Arrakis.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel about a society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn them.

title: The Invisible Man
author: H.G. Wells
description: A scientist becomes invisible and struggles with the consequences of his discovery.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The second volume in the epic fantasy trilogy, filled with action and intrigue.

title: The Dark Tower: The Gunslinger
author: Stephen King
description: A supernatural epic that follows Roland, the last gunslinger, on his quest to find the Dark Tower.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: The first book in The Kingkiller Chronicle, telling the story of Kvothe, a legendary figure.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: A gripping science fiction tale of an astronaut stranded on Mars.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
description: A cyberpunk novel that laid the foundation for the genre, involving hackers and artificial intelligence.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe
author: C.S. Lewis
description: The first book in the beloved fantasy series where children travel to a magical world.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A comedic science fiction series about Arthur Dent and his journey through space.

title: The Catcher in the Rye (Special Edition)

description: A limited edition hardcover of the classic novel.
